Key Match Events: Harry Kane scored an early goal in extra time against Slovakia to set up the quarter-final match against Switzerland.
Jude Bellingham scored a stoppage-time equaliser against Slovakia.
England won 5-3 on penalties against Switzerland.
Schar received a yellow card in the 32nd minute.
Widmer received a yellow card in the 85th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: England left-back Luke Shaw is expected to be passed fit for the quarter-final against Switzerland.
England ousted Slovakia in a dramatic last-16 tie.
Shaw's fitness has been a subject of speculation due to his hamstring injury.
Shaw's absence resulted in an unbalanced side, with Kieran Trippier operating on the left side of defence.
Shaw is likely to be fit for the quarter-final to give England a boost.
England boss Gareth Southgate may be reluctant to start Shaw due to his lack of match practice.
Southgate may use Shaw as a left wing-back and switch to a back three.
Alternative options for the left side include Bukayo Saka, Eberechi Eze, Trent Alexander-Arnold, and Kieran Trippier.
